meanings.definition: To earn more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outearn her coworker by working extra hours.
meanings.sent2: He always strives to outearn his competitors in the sales department.
meanings.sent3: The race to outearn each other in the lemonade stand business was fierce.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outearn her siblings was like a fire burning within her.
meanings.sent5: The idea of outearning others motivated him to push himself harder.

meanings.definition: To make more money than someone else.
meanings.sent1: In order to outearn his friend, he took on multiple part-time jobs.
meanings.sent2: The goal of the business is to consistently outearn its competitors.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel managed to outearn the other animals by collecting the most nuts.
meanings.sent4: Her investment strategy allowed her to outearn even the most experienced traders.
meanings.sent5: The young entrepreneur's innovative idea helped him outearn established companies.
